items.title: At least 15 people killed after funicular railway in Lisbon derails
items.standfirst: President laments accident on railway that carries passengers up and down hillside in Portugal’s capital At least 15 people have been killed after Lisbon’s Gloria funicular railway car derailed and crashed on Wednesday, an emergency medical service spokesperson has said.Authorities would not identify the victims or disclose their nationalities, but said some foreign nationals were among the dead. At least 18 people were also injured. Continue reading...
items.content: President laments accident on railway that carries passengers up and down hillside in Portugal’s capital At least 15 people have been killed after Lisbon’s Gloria funicular railway car derailed and crashed on Wednesday, an emergency medical service spokesperson has said.Authorities would not identify the victims or disclose their nationalities, but said some foreign nationals were among the dead. At least 18 people were also injured. Continue reading...

items.title: Lisbon's funicular streetcar derails, killing at least 15
items.standfirst: At least 15 people were killed after Lisbon's popular funicular streetcar derailed in Portugal's capital, officials said Wednesday. It's unclear what caused the funicular, called the Elevador da Glória, to crash.
items.content: At least 15 people were killed after Lisbon's popular funicular streetcar derailed in Portugal's capital, officials said Wednesday. It's unclear what caused the funicular, called the Elevador da Glória, to crash.

items.title: What we know about fatal Lisbon funicular derailment
items.standfirst: At least 15 people have been killed and 20 more injured after a carriage on the Gloria funicular derailed and crashed.
items.content: At least 15 people have been killed and 20 more injured after a carriage on the Gloria funicular derailed and crashed.

items.title: At least 15 people dead after streetcar derails in Lisbon
items.standfirst: At least 15 people have died and more than a dozen are injured after a popular streetcar derailed in Lisbon. The funicular that crashed, the Elevador de Gloria, runs between the Baixa and Bairro Alto neighborhoods in Lisbon. Portuguese authorities have announced an investigation into the crash, and local officials have called for three days of mourning.
items.content: At least 15 people have died and more than a dozen are injured after a popular streetcar derailed in Lisbon. The funicular that crashed, the Elevador de Gloria, runs between the Baixa and Bairro Alto neighborhoods in Lisbon. Portuguese authorities have announced an investigation into the crash, and local officials have called for three days of mourning.

items.title: Landmark streetcar derails and crashes in Lisbon, killing 15 people

items.content: An electric streetcar that is one of Lisbon’s landmarks and a big draw for tourists derailed Wednesday, killing 15 people and injuring 18 others, emergency services said.

items.title: At least 15 dead after iconic Lisbon funicular derails
items.standfirst: A Lisbon funicular derailed on Wednesday, killing at least 15 people and injuring 18 others in one of the city’s busiest tourist areas, emergency services said. Images showed the iconic yellow Gloria car overturned on a steep street as firefighters and medics rushed to the scene.
items.content: A Lisbon funicular derailed on Wednesday, killing at least 15 people and injuring 18 others in one of the city’s busiest tourist areas, emergency services said. Images showed the iconic yellow Gloria car overturned on a steep street as firefighters and medics rushed to the scene.

items.title: Fifteen dead after Lisbon's iconic funicular derails and crashes

items.content: At least 15 people have died and 18 are injured after the iconic Gloria funicular in Lisbon derailed and crashed, emergency services have said.

ai_summary: A funicular streetcar derailed in Lisbon, Portugal, resulting in at least fifteen fatalities.
The Elevador da Glória, a popular funicular, crashed between the Baixa and Bairro Alto neighborhoods.
Authorities are investigating the cause of the derailment, which also injured over a dozen people.
Portuguese officials announced an investigation into the cause of the deadly crash.
Italian Prime Minister Meloni offered condolences following the tragic incident.

items.title: Putin waves off Trump’s Russia-China-North Korean conspiracy comments

items.content: Vladimir Putin laughed off Donald Trump’s claim that Russia, China and North Korea were conspiring against the US.

items.title: Kim Jong-un promises to do ‘everything to assist’ Moscow after Putin meeting
items.standfirst: North Korean leader invited to visit Russia as Zelenskyy says Putin is displaying ‘impunity’ with new Ukraine strikes Europe live – latest updatesVladimir Putin has invited Kim Jong-un to visit Russia during a lengthy meeting in Beijing on the sidelines of China’s biggest military parade, as Kim promised to do “everything I can to assist” Moscow.North Korea has supported Russia in its war against Ukraine with weapons and troops, and the Russian president praised North Korean fighters for acting “courageously and heroically”. Continue reading...

items.content: The military parade was attended by world leaders including Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong Un and showcased China’s new weapons.

ai_summary: China held its largest military parade, attended by Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong Un.
Kim Jong Un promised to assist Moscow, and Putin thanked him for military support.
Donald Trump accused Xi Jinping of conspiring against the US with Putin and Kim.
The parade marked the 80th anniversary of the end of World War II in China.
Putin and Xi discussed organ transplants and the possibility of living indefinitely.

clusters.title: Hot mic catches Putin and Xi discussing organ transplants and immortality
clusters.neutral_headline: Xi and Putin Discuss Organ Transplants, Immortality

items.title: Hot mic catches Putin and Xi discussing organ transplants and immortality
items.standfirst: A hot mic caught Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin talking about organ transplants and immortality as the leaders walked together on the sidelines of the military parade in Beijing.
items.content: A hot mic caught Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin talking about organ transplants and immortality as the leaders walked together on the sidelines of the military parade in Beijing.

items.title: Putin says he discussed longevity, immortality with Xi Jinping
items.standfirst: Presidents Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping were caught on a hot mic on Wednesday discussing human longevity in a brief exchange that touched on living to 150 years old and even the prospect of “immortality.” The unscripted conversation took place right before a military parade in Beijing, which marked 80 years since Japan’s surrender in World War II. FRANCE 24's James Vasina reports.
items.content: Presidents Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping were caught on a hot mic on Wednesday discussing human longevity in a brief exchange that touched on living to 150 years old and even the prospect of “immortality.” The unscripted conversation took place right before a military parade in Beijing, which marked 80 years since Japan’s surrender in World War II. FRANCE 24's James Vasina reports.

items.title: Watch: Xi and Putin discuss organ transplants and living 'indefinitely'
items.standfirst: The two leaders discussed how organ transplants could help people live to 150-years-old.
items.content: The two leaders discussed how organ transplants could help people live to 150-years-old.

items.title: Putin tells Xi organ transplants could offer immortality
items.standfirst: Chinese premier noted predictions that humans could live to 150 in this century
items.content: Chinese premier noted predictions that humans could live to 150 in this century

items.title: Hot mic catches Xi and Putin discussing organ transplants and immortality
items.standfirst: The Chinese and Russian leaders have been in power for 13 and 25 years respectively, with neither expressing any intention of stepping down.
items.content: The Chinese and Russian leaders have been in power for 13 and 25 years respectively, with neither expressing any intention of stepping down.

items.title: Xi Jinping says world faces ‘peace or war’, as Putin and Kim join him for military parade
items.standfirst: Trump criticises victory day event as China caps off week of diplomatic grandstanding seen as rebuke to the westXi Jinping said the world was facing a choice between peace or war as he held China’s largest-ever military parade, joined by Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong-un in a show of defiance to the west.Putin and Kim, the authoritarian leaders of Russia and North Korea, were among dozens of world leaders who attended the parade, a massive display of military hardware and personnel, orchestrated to mark the 80th anniversary of the end of the second world war, which China calls the War of Resistance against Japanese Aggression. Continue reading...
items.content: Trump criticises victory day event as China caps off week of diplomatic grandstanding seen as rebuke to the westXi Jinping said the world was facing a choice between peace or war as he held China’s largest-ever military parade, joined by Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong-un in a show of defiance to the west.Putin and Kim, the authoritarian leaders of Russia and North Korea, were among dozens of world leaders who attended the parade, a massive display of military hardware and personnel, orchestrated to mark the 80th anniversary of the end of the second world war, which China calls the War of Resistance against Japanese Aggression. Continue reading...

items.title: Hot mic catches Putin and Xi discussing organ transplants and immortality
items.standfirst: Live footage of private conversation between Russian president and Chinese leader aired at Beijing military paradeThe authoritarian strongmen Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping have mused on how organ transplants might lead to immortality, during a brief exchange of small talk caught on a hot mic at a military parade.The Russian president was in Beijing on Wednesday with the Chinese leader, who hosted allies for a ceremony to mark the 80th anniversary of the end of the second world war. Continue reading...
items.content: Live footage of private conversation between Russian president and Chinese leader aired at Beijing military paradeThe authoritarian strongmen Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping have mused on how organ transplants might lead to immortality, during a brief exchange of small talk caught on a hot mic at a military parade.The Russian president was in Beijing on Wednesday with the Chinese leader, who hosted allies for a ceremony to mark the 80th anniversary of the end of the second world war. Continue reading...

items.title: Xi, Putin and Kim: behind the choreographed image that could symbolise a shift in the global balance of power
items.standfirst: In an unprecedented spectacle the leaders of Russia, China and North Korea led a group of more than 20 world leaders at a victory day parade in BeijingFull report: Xi Jinping appears with Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong-un at China military paradeIt is an image that, had it been published just a few years ago, would have been dismissed as a piece of mischievous photo-shopping: the leaders of Russia and China, accompanied by the head of a pariah regime whose mission to arm his country with nuclear weapons had been opposed at the United Nations by his two companions.But dramatic shifts in the geopolitical landscape – Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and, crucially, the re-election of Donald Trump – have combined to bring Xi Jinping, Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un together in what many observers are calling a dramatic redrawing of the global balance of power. Continue reading...
items.content: In an unprecedented spectacle the leaders of Russia, China and North Korea led a group of more than 20 world leaders at a victory day parade in BeijingFull report: Xi Jinping appears with Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong-un at China military paradeIt is an image that, had it been published just a few years ago, would have been dismissed as a piece of mischievous photo-shopping: the leaders of Russia and China, accompanied by the head of a pariah regime whose mission to arm his country with nuclear weapons had been opposed at the United Nations by his two companions.But dramatic shifts in the geopolitical landscape – Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and, crucially, the re-election of Donald Trump – have combined to bring Xi Jinping, Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un together in what many observers are calling a dramatic redrawing of the global balance of power. Continue reading...

items.title: Putin hails ties with China as Kim Jong-un arrives in Beijing on eve of parade
items.standfirst: Russian president says relations at ‘unprecedentedly high level’ as dozens of leaders gather for Victory Day eventsVladimir Putin has hailed Russia’s “unprecedentedly” high level of ties with China, as dozens of leaders including the North Korean dictator, Kim Jong-un, arrived in Beijing on the eve of a massive military parade intended to showcase a Chinese-led global order.Putin called China’s leader, Xi Jinping, a “dear friend” after the two held talks at the Great Hall of the People and then at Xi’s personal residence. “Our close communication reflects the strategic nature of Russia-China relations, which are at an unprecedentedly high level,” Putin told Xi, according to a video on the Kremlin’s Telegram channel. “We were always together then, and we remain together now.” Continue reading...
items.content: Russian president says relations at ‘unprecedentedly high level’ as dozens of leaders gather for Victory Day eventsVladimir Putin has hailed Russia’s “unprecedentedly” high level of ties with China, as dozens of leaders including the North Korean dictator, Kim Jong-un, arrived in Beijing on the eve of a massive military parade intended to showcase a Chinese-led global order.Putin called China’s leader, Xi Jinping, a “dear friend” after the two held talks at the Great Hall of the People and then at Xi’s personal residence. “Our close communication reflects the strategic nature of Russia-China relations, which are at an unprecedentedly high level,” Putin told Xi, according to a video on the Kremlin’s Telegram channel. “We were always together then, and we remain together now.” Continue reading...

ai_summary: Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin discussed organ transplants and longevity on a hot mic.
The leaders' conversation touched on living to 150 years old and the prospect of immortality.
The discussion occurred before a military parade in Beijing.
The parade marked the 80th anniversary of Japan's surrender in World War II.
The two leaders have been in power for many years and have not expressed intentions to step down.

items.title: Judge reverses Trump administration’s cuts of billions in research funding to Harvard

items.content: A federal judge in Boston on Wednesday ordered the reversal of the Trump administration’s cuts to more than $2.6 billion in funding research grants for Harvard University.

items.title: Trump Administration Suffers Legal Blow Over Harvard Funding
items.standfirst: Judge Burroughs sided with Harvard in ruling the cuts amounted to illegal retaliation for Harvard's rejection of White House demands.
items.content: Judge Burroughs sided with Harvard in ruling the cuts amounted to illegal retaliation for Harvard's rejection of White House demands.

items.title: Trump unlawfully cancelled $2.2bn in Harvard research grants, judge rules
items.standfirst: Decision marks major victory for school after White House accused it of not addressing harassment of Jewish studentsA federal judge on Wednesday ruled Donald Trump’s administration unlawfully terminated about $2.2bn in grants awarded to Harvard University and can no longer cut off research funding to the Ivy League school.The decision by US district judge Allison Burroughs in Boston marked a major legal victory for Harvard as it seeks to cut a deal that could bring an end to the White House’s multi-front conflict with the country’s oldest and richest university. Continue reading...
items.content: Decision marks major victory for school after White House accused it of not addressing harassment of Jewish studentsA federal judge on Wednesday ruled Donald Trump’s administration unlawfully terminated about $2.2bn in grants awarded to Harvard University and can no longer cut off research funding to the Ivy League school.The decision by US district judge Allison Burroughs in Boston marked a major legal victory for Harvard as it seeks to cut a deal that could bring an end to the White House’s multi-front conflict with the country’s oldest and richest university. Continue reading...

items.title: Judge voids $2.2 billion Harvard funding freeze by Trump administration
items.standfirst: The Trump administration in April froze grants to Harvard University over concerns about antisemitism on the Ivy League campus and other concerns.
items.content: The Trump administration in April froze grants to Harvard University over concerns about antisemitism on the Ivy League campus and other concerns.

ai_summary: A judge ruled the Trump administration's funding freeze against Harvard was unlawful.
The judge ordered the unfreezing of nearly $2.2 billion in federal grants to Harvard.
The court found the administration's actions violated Harvard's First Amendment rights.
The Trump administration's demands on Harvard were deemed unconstitutional.
The ruling is a victory for Harvard University in its legal battle.

items.content: Many remain trapped under rubble as rescuers use helicopters in remote areas hit by recent landslides.

items.title: Afghanistan death toll passes 1,400 as second earthquake strikes
items.standfirst: Taliban appeal for aid, with casualties expected to increase as rescue teams struggle to reach isolated areas The Taliban have called for international aid as Afghanistan reels from an earthquake that killed more than 1,400 people and left thousands more injured.Rescuers searched into the night for survivors after the 6.0-magnitude quake struck on Sunday destroying entire villages across the country’s eastern Kunar province, which borders Pakistan. Continue reading...
items.content: Taliban appeal for aid, with casualties expected to increase as rescue teams struggle to reach isolated areas The Taliban have called for international aid as Afghanistan reels from an earthquake that killed more than 1,400 people and left thousands more injured.Rescuers searched into the night for survivors after the 6.0-magnitude quake struck on Sunday destroying entire villages across the country’s eastern Kunar province, which borders Pakistan. Continue reading...

items.title: Death toll soars past 1,400 as rescuers battle to reach earthquake survivors in Afghanistan

items.content: The death toll passed 1,400 in the 6.0 magnitude earthquake that hit Afghanistan, the Taliban said, as rescuers raced to reach survivors trapped in remote areas.

ai_summary: An earthquake in Afghanistan killed over 1,400 people, with many trapped.
Rescuers are struggling to reach survivors in remote areas.
The Taliban has appealed for international aid.
The earthquake had a magnitude of 6.0.
The quake destroyed entire villages in eastern Afghanistan.

items.title: France fines Google, Shein record sums over cookie law violations
items.standfirst: France’s data protection watchdog CNIL on Wednesday fined Google €325 million ($380 million) and fast-fashion retailer Shein €150 million ($175 million) for violating cookie rules. The record penalties target two platforms with tens of millions of French users, marking among the heaviest sanctions the regulator has imposed.
items.content: France’s data protection watchdog CNIL on Wednesday fined Google €325 million ($380 million) and fast-fashion retailer Shein €150 million ($175 million) for violating cookie rules. The record penalties target two platforms with tens of millions of French users, marking among the heaviest sanctions the regulator has imposed.

clusters.title: REPLAY: Trump hosts Poland's new nationalist president in Washington

items.title: REPLAY: Trump hosts Poland's new nationalist president in Washington
items.standfirst: Poland’s new president, Karol Nawrocki, arrived at the White House on Wednesday, looking to strengthen his relationship with President Donald Trump and make the case that the United States needs to maintain its robust military presence in his country.
items.content: Poland’s new president, Karol Nawrocki, arrived at the White House on Wednesday, looking to strengthen his relationship with President Donald Trump and make the case that the United States needs to maintain its robust military presence in his country.

items.title: Trump meets with Poland's new nationalist president in Washington
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump welcomed Poland's new nationalist president, Karol Nawrocki, to the White House on Wednesday with a military flyover and a pledge to bolster the US troop presence in the eastern European country. The Oval Office talks centered on the war in Ukraine, where Trump’s struggling peace push loomed large over the visit.
items.content: US President Donald Trump welcomed Poland's new nationalist president, Karol Nawrocki, to the White House on Wednesday with a military flyover and a pledge to bolster the US troop presence in the eastern European country. The Oval Office talks centered on the war in Ukraine, where Trump’s struggling peace push loomed large over the visit.

items.title: Trump pledges to ‘stand with Warsaw’ in meeting with Polish president
items.standfirst: US president praises Karol Nawrocki for election win and says he was not considering pulling troops from PolandEurope live – latest updatesThe US president, Donald Trump, has said he was not considering pulling US troops out of Poland and pledged to stand with Warsaw “all the way” during a meeting with the country’s conservative nationalist president, Karol Nawrocki, at the White House.Backed by the populist rightwing opposition Law and Justice party, which ruled Poland between 2015 and 2023, Karol Nawrocki unexpectedly won Poland’s presidential election after running a campaign under a Trumpesque slogan of “Poland first, Poles first”. Continue reading...
items.content: US president praises Karol Nawrocki for election win and says he was not considering pulling troops from PolandEurope live – latest updatesThe US president, Donald Trump, has said he was not considering pulling US troops out of Poland and pledged to stand with Warsaw “all the way” during a meeting with the country’s conservative nationalist president, Karol Nawrocki, at the White House.Backed by the populist rightwing opposition Law and Justice party, which ruled Poland between 2015 and 2023, Karol Nawrocki unexpectedly won Poland’s presidential election after running a campaign under a Trumpesque slogan of “Poland first, Poles first”. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump offers to boost US forces in Poland in White House meeting with nationalist president
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump welcomed the new Polish President Karol Nawrocki to the White House on Wednesday, pledging to bolster US troop presence in the eastern European country. The Oval Office talks centred on the war in Ukraine, which Trump has struggled to influence, calling it a “stupid war” that he thought would have been “much easier” to end.
items.content: US President Donald Trump welcomed the new Polish President Karol Nawrocki to the White House on Wednesday, pledging to bolster US troop presence in the eastern European country. The Oval Office talks centred on the war in Ukraine, which Trump has struggled to influence, calling it a “stupid war” that he thought would have been “much easier” to end.

ai_summary: Donald Trump met with Poland's new president, Karol Nawrocki, in Washington.
Trump pledged to bolster the US troop presence in Poland.
The meeting included a military flyover to welcome the Polish president.
Discussions focused on the war in Ukraine and Trump's peace efforts.
Trump said he was not considering pulling troops from Poland.

items.title: Israel strikes purported safe zone in Gaza, killing at least seven children
items.standfirst: Palestinian health authorities said at least 13 people were killed, including seven children, in an Israeli strike as they tried to collect drinking water in al-Mawasi — the area the Israeli military directed Palestinians to go to that same day, promising access to water, food and medicine. The Israeli military told NBC News that it had no record of strikes in the area of al-Mawasi that day.

The Israeli military told NBC News that it had no record of strikes in the area of al-Mawasi that day.

items.standfirst: Latest attack comes as Israel’s military urges people to leave Gaza City with 60,000 more reservists to be called upAt least nine people, including five children, have been killed in an Israeli strike while fetching water in al-Mawasi, an area of southern Gaza which Israel has designated as a safe zone, health officials said.A doctor from al-Nasser hospital shared a picture of the children’s bodies in the hospital, as well as a picture of water jugs left in a pool of blood at the site of the attack on Tuesday. Continue reading...

The Israeli military stated it had no record of strikes in the area.

items.content: Kim Jong Un was joined by his daughter Kim Ju Ae at the China military parade in Beijing, as she emerges as the likely successor in North Korea.

items.title: What do we know about Kim Jong Un's daughter - and potential successor?
items.standfirst: Kim Ju Ae's visit to China with her father is likely to further fuel speculation she may succeed him.
items.content: Kim Ju Ae's visit to China with her father is likely to further fuel speculation she may succeed him.

ai_summary: Kim Jong Un and his daughter attended a military parade in China.
Kim Ju Ae, his daughter, is seen as a potential successor.
The visit fueled speculation about her future role in North Korea.
The parade was held in Beijing, China.
Kim Ju Ae has been appearing in public with her father.

clusters.title: Race to find survivors after Sudan landslide kills hundreds
clusters.neutral_headline: Sudan landslide kills hundreds

items.title: Race to find survivors after Sudan landslide kills hundreds
items.standfirst: Sunday's landslide followed heavy rain and "levelled" a remote village, a local armed group says.
items.content: Sunday's landslide followed heavy rain and "levelled" a remote village, a local armed group says.

items.title: Sudan landslide kills at least 1,000 people, rebel group says
items.standfirst: Landslide destroyed a village in the Marra mountains area of western Sudan and left only one survivorMore than 1,000 people have been killed in a landslide in western Sudan, according to a rebel group that controls the area.The landslide on Sunday, which followed heavy rain, destroyed the village of Tarasin in the Marra mountains area of western Sudan and left only one survivor, the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM) said. Continue reading...
items.content: Landslide destroyed a village in the Marra mountains area of western Sudan and left only one survivorMore than 1,000 people have been killed in a landslide in western Sudan, according to a rebel group that controls the area.The landslide on Sunday, which followed heavy rain, destroyed the village of Tarasin in the Marra mountains area of western Sudan and left only one survivor, the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM) said. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A landslide in Sudan killed at least 1,000 people.
The landslide destroyed a village in the Marra mountains.
The Sudan Liberation Movement/Army reported the casualties.
The landslide followed heavy rainfall in the area.
Only one survivor was reported from the affected village.

clusters.title: Trump says 11 killed in US strike on drug-carrying vessel from Venezuela
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump says 11 killed in US strike on drug-carrying vessel from Venezuela

items.title: Trump says 11 killed in US strike on drug-carrying vessel from Venezuela
items.standfirst: The Trump administration has signalled a willingness to use military force against drug cartels.
items.content: The Trump administration has signalled a willingness to use military force against drug cartels.

items.title: Trump says 11 dead in strike on Venezuelan drugs boat
items.standfirst: A strike on what the US called a Venezuelan gang's drug-carrying vessel killed 11 people, Donald Trump has said.
items.content: A strike on what the US called a Venezuelan gang's drug-carrying vessel killed 11 people, Donald Trump has said.

ai_summary: Donald Trump stated that 11 people died in a US strike.
The strike targeted a vessel carrying drugs from Venezuela.
The US government described the vessel as belonging to a gang.
The Trump administration has signaled a willingness to use force.
The strike occurred on a drug-carrying vessel.
